intro: Bidens novae-caledoniae, commonly known as the New Caledonia ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and stream sides. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped with serrated edges, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
